description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve access to essential services and economic markets, via the provision of all weather roads, for the resident population in the hinterland of the project roads.

condition.narrative: The Borrower, shall prepare a COM decision to be passed not later than December 31 2008 to transfer all secondary roads from theregional councils to GRD
The Recipient will ensure that no sub-project is located elsewhere on the Albanian coast, unless a development plan has beenapproved by the Territorial Council
The Recipient will ensure that no sub-project is located in the area covered by the Southern Coastal Zone Development Plan, untilsuch plan has been approved by the Territorial Council

title.narrative: Share of rural population with access to an all-season road

comment.narrative: The introduced baseline derives from the % against total population of 11 regions with access to all season roads, before theproject - data source ADF surveys and INSTAT

target is introduced by adding to the baseline the % that population of 50 communities (see the respective indicator below),planned to benefit from the project, represents, against the total population of 11 regions - data source ADF surveys and INSTAT

actual figure results by adding to the baseline the % that population of actual 81 benefiting communities (see the respectiveindicator below) represent, against the total population of 11 regions - data source ADF surveys and INSTAT

title.narrative: Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads

comment.narrative: suppl. value is for rural roads in Albania, of which project roads are a part.
Actual 34%

title.narrative: Size of the total classified network

comment.narrative: suppl. value is for rural roads in Albania, of which project roads are a part.
Actual 32.5%

title.narrative: Number of communities that have improved access to markets, social services and administrative centers by project end

comment.narrative: This number has been used to define the share and no. of population with access to all season roads
This reflects that all 109.9 km of road has been substantially completed. This number has been used to define the share and no. ofpopulation with access to all season roads

title.narrative: Number of people in the communities trained to procure contractors to undertake maintenance

comment.narrative: Target is established based on the original plan of extending training, to the respective Units (2-4 staff) in all 11regions/qarksof the project.
ADF has provided detailed reports on the number of people trained and the communities they belong to; the target is introduced in2012 ISR

title.narrative: Number of people trained to undertake maintenance

comment.narrative: Target is established based on the original plan of extending training, to the respective Units (2-4 staff) in all 11regions/qarksof the project.
ADF has provided detailed reports on the number of people trained and the communities they belong to; the target is introduced in2012 ISR

title.narrative: Change in road user perception of road quality

comment.narrative: Results exceed the target. The ADF Beneficiary Assessment survey, showed that 97% of the interviewees asserted that the roadsafterinvestment were in good or very good condition, whereas previously 94% of interviewees asserted that the roads before theinvestmentwere in bad or very bad conditions. The difference between the two positions, on the 1 to 10 Likert scale correspond tolevel 6 (or60% change).

title.narrative: Proportional increase in traffic volumes on project roads - one year after scheme complettion

comment.narrative: Target was met and exceeded as reported in previous ISR, and updated with ADF during April 2013 mission.

title.narrative: Proportional reduction in travel time on project roads in free flowing conditions

comment.narrative: Targets met and exceeded as according to the updated information from ADF during April 2013 mission

title.narrative: Increase in annual recurrent maintenance budget for National roads

comment.narrative: The cumulative figure of increase is calculated based on a 5% target annual increase, which on the other hand has been previously(projects and CPS) agreed with the government as a good initiative to cover the maintenance needs
The ADF has collected this information from MPWT/ARA and MoF.

title.narrative: Increase in annual recurrent maintenance budget for Local roads

comment.narrative: The cumulative figure of increase is calculated based on a 5% target annual increase, which on the other hand has been previously(projects and CPS) agreed with the government as a good initiative to cover the maintenance needs
The ADF has collected this information from MPWT/ARA and MoF.
the length of the road is slightly increased to accommodate community needs, and is expected to by the introduction of two newsections

title.narrative: Management Information System in place and functioning

comment.narrative: ADF reported during April 2013 mission on the use of ROMAPS, inventory and prioritization system for the whole secondary and localroads network

title.narrative: Number of rural people with access to an all-season road

comment.narrative: No robust data available for this indicator. TTL will investigate data options during next supervision mission.
